step.goal: Scan for hardcoded secrets and sensitive data exposure
step.critical: This is the MOST CRITICAL check â€” do this FIRST

check-list.item: API keys, tokens, passwords hardcoded in source code
Private keys, certificates embedded in code
Database connection strings with credentials
Secrets in config files that should be in environment variables
Sensitive data logged to console (passwords, tokens, PII)
Stack traces exposed to end users (reveals internal structure)

step.goal: OWASP A01-A05: Broken Access Control, Crypto, Injection, Insecure Design, Misconfiguration
step.note: Run only if relevant to the project type and the changes in this PR. Skip entirely if this category has no applicability.

check-list.item: A01 Broken Access Control: authorization checks present? role-based? privilege escalation possible?
A02 Cryptographic Failures: weak hashing (MD5/SHA1)? HTTP instead of HTTPS? key management?
A03 Injection: SQL injection? XSS? command injection? template injection? all inputs sanitized?
A04 Insecure Design: security by obscurity? missing security controls at design level?
A05 Security Misconfiguration: debug mode enabled? default credentials? unnecessary features exposed?

step.goal: OWASP A06-A10: Vulnerable Components, Auth, Integrity, Logging, SSRF
step.note: Run only if relevant to the project type and the changes in this PR. Skip entirely if this category has no applicability.

check-list.item: A06 Vulnerable Components: new dependencies added? check for known CVEs
A07 Auth Failures: session management? password policies? brute force protection? JWT validation?
A08 Integrity Failures: deserialization of untrusted data? unsigned data accepted?
A09 Logging/Monitoring: security events logged? sensitive data excluded from logs?
A10 SSRF: user-controlled URLs fetched? internal services accessible?

step.note: Run only if relevant to the project type and the changes in this PR. Skip entirely if this category has no applicability.

check-list.item: Rate limiting on auth endpoints (login, register, password reset)
Input length limits enforced server-side
File upload: type validation, size limits, storage location security
CORS configuration: not wildcard (*) on sensitive endpoints
